title: Display partner's yearly, monthly, weekly, and daily planner entries in sharing sections

requirements.summary: Add a partner-view tab in YearlyPlanner page to display the partner's yearly planner entry as read-only content
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Partner's Plan' tab or section is visible in YearlyPlanner
The partner's word of the year, goals, vision URLs, habit tracker, and reflection are displayed
The section is read-only â€” the current user cannot edit the partner's data
If no partner is linked or the partner has no entry, a friendly empty state message is shown
The current user's own planner data is unaffected

file_operations.description: Add a tab-based UI that switches between 'My Plan' and 'Partner's Plan' views. In the partner tab, fetch the partner's yearly entry using the partner's principal from the couple relationship, then display word of the year, major goals, vision image URLs, monthly habit tracker grid, and year-end reflection as read-only content. Show a friendly empty state if no partner is linked or no entry exists. Ensure year navigation applies to both tabs.

requirements.summary: Add a partner-view tab in MonthlyPlanner page to display the partner's monthly planner entry as read-only content
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Partner's Plan' tab or section is visible in MonthlyPlanner
The partner's goals, important dates, budget, and mood tracker for the selected month are displayed
The section is read-only
If no partner is linked or the partner has no entry for the month, a friendly empty state message is shown
Month navigation applies to the partner view as well

requirements.summary: Add React Query hooks for fetching partner planner entries by principal
acceptanceCriteria: A hook exists to fetch the partner's yearly planner entry
A hook exists to fetch the partner's monthly planner entry
A hook exists to fetch the partner's weekly planner entry
A hook exists to fetch the partner's daily planner entry
Hooks follow the same pattern as existing hooks in useQueries.ts
Hooks return loading, error, and data states

file_operations.description: Add four new React Query hooks: usePartnerYearlyEntries, usePartnerMonthlyEntries, usePartnerWeeklyEntries, and usePartnerDailyPlannerEntries. Each hook accepts a partner principal and the relevant time parameter (year, month/year, week/year, or date) and calls the corresponding backend query function (getPartnerSpecificYearlyEntries, getPartnerSpecificMonthlyEntries, getPartnerSpecificWeeklyEntries, getPartnerSpecificDailyPlannerEntries). Follow the existing hook patterns for enabled conditions, error handling, and returning loading/error/data states.
